backdate.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to make something have its effect from an earlier date
backdate.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The pay increase will be backdated to January.
backdate.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to write an earlier date on a document or cheque than when it was actually written
backdate.translation[1].definitions[0].d: if a change in an amount paid is backdated, it has its effect from an earlier date
backdate.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Postal workers are getting a 3.3% wage rise backdated to October.
backdate.translation[1].definitions[1].d: to put a date on a document that is earlier than the real date
backdate.translation[1].definitions[1].e: It was alleged that he had backdated the sale documents to evade a court order.
